transcript:
Guys... Guys... GUYS! We have something to celebrate 
today - and it's not my birthday. 'Cause, guys... Guys... WE DID IT! Hi there, I'm Malbert!  Oh my goodness. You know when you're 
so nervous that you don't know whether to laugh, cry, tremble or eat a sobrasada sandwich?
 [Mallorcan spicy sausage] You just don't know what to do.
Yup, that's me. I'm dead nervous! Now, I'll try and keep my cool during this video 
so that I can tell you what happened. Francesco Gabbani has sent me a message! 
He sent me a tweet! TO ME! Ladies and gentlemen,
Francesco Gabbani said HI TO ME! ['Viva el amor' ‚Äì Loona]
*hooray, long live love* *feel the latin beat* No, I just can't keep cool.  How can I keep cool? 
I'm about to pass out! OK, keep calm, relax... So, as you all know - and if you don't, 
watch my previous video where I told you how a follower started the hashtag 
#FrancescoMalberEsiste to get Francesco's attention,  so that he could say Hi to me - I asked you all to 
tweet that hashtag, starting that day at 9 p.m. So, that video was uploaded on Thursday 
and we'd have to start tweeting from 9 p.m. And so it was. When 9 p.m. arrived, 
you started sending a bunch of tweets - and I mean a whole bunch, 
like, a SUPER bunch of tweets - with #FrancescoMalberEsiste. And earlier on, I was thinking like: 
it is a long hashtag and it's written in Italian... ...not even God will use it! Right...How foolish of you, Malbert! You started using it like crazy. I started getting like, 
30 notifications per minute. Tons of tweets, tons of pictures, 
photo edits, memes,  everyone asking "Please Francesco say Hi to him!",
 in Italian, in English, in Spanish... I mean, TONS of tweets. 
And I was like...flipping out. I was like, 
"WTF, what's going on here?" I totally flipped, 'cause you kept on 
hitting that hashtag for a whole hour! Really, you guys rock! And then I was thinking like,  "It's been an hour hitting that hashtag, 
there's no way we can be a top trending topic." 'Cause never in my life 
was I a trending topic.  Me? Top trending topic? 
SAY WHAT? But hey, no harm in dreaming, right? So I thought that maybe we could get our 
hashtag trend on Spain's Top Trending Topic list. Maybe, who knows? If Valentina Monetta gets to go 
so many times to the ESC, why can't I dream of this, may I ask? So, after one hour I was almost giving up on the 
idea of featuring on the top trending topic's list. And suddenly when I checked‚Ä¶  You can imagine my poker face when I hit the 
button "Check Spain‚Äôs Top Trending Topic List" and... ...there I am. Me. I mean, I was there. I mean, how...when? 
WTF has just happened? WTF has just happened? We were the last on the list. 
We were on Spain's Top Trending Topic List! ['Viva el amor' ‚Äì Loona]
*hooray, long live love* Seriously, I was holding my phone like this... "I can‚Äôt-", retweet, retweet. "Wh-What's happening?" "This can't be happening to me." Like a freakin' jelly. I was so nervous 
I was shaking like a jelly. I just could not believe - ME? 
Say what? And there were more and more 
people joining in. It was incredible, all the support 
we were getting from so many people. And I'm still like, I don't believe this. 
I still can‚Äôt believe this! More and more, we were moving up the 
list until we reached the 6th position. We were the 6th trending topic on Twitter!  Even surpassing Manel Navarro's!
[this year's Spain ESC entry] Oh, too bad! We've surpassed you, Manel. 
What a pity! Me -a small town freakin' nobody- becoming 
the sixth trending topic on Twitter in Spain. If anyone had told me that, a few hours 
earlier, I wouldn't have believed it.  I wouldn't. It was as if somebody told you that Valentina 
Monetta was not showing up anymore at the ESC. You would say: 
"No freakin' way." It would be just about the same. Well, and things just sort of 
stayed that way.  Not one 'like' from Francesco Gabbani,
not even a retweet. We haven't heard from him 
for the whole night. And I went to bed dead nervous, 
my eyes were like two big oranges.  I couldn't fall asleep for 3 hours because of all 
the hype, of all the excitement inside me. My eyes were like two oranges,
just like this. And the next day, 
still no word from Francesco Gabbani. Tell me - what do I have to do? Set up camp at your place and start 
throwing rocks at your window, I wonder? Oh, and can you imagine the moment when
Francesco checks his Twitter account? I'm telling you, if I got more than 2,000 
notifications, I can't imagine his phone! I can't even imagine Gabbani's reaction when getting 
on Twitter and seeing my face everywhere, pictures of my videos, 
"Francesco, say Hi to Malbert!", #FrancescoMalberEsiste, 
"Please say Hi to him!" - everywhere. And there I was thinking like:  either he finds this whole thing 
really funny and gives me a shout-out,  or I end up being taken to the police
and being accused of harassment. Though I found the second option 
more likely to happen. But a few hours later, to my surprise 
and half Europe's too, this happened: Francesco has read our messages, 
he has given us personal attention,  and to top it off: he has sent me 
a freakin' shout-out! To ME! ['Viva el amor' ‚Äì Loona]
*hooray, long live love* I'm the winner? I'm the winner!
[mocking Spain's Ruth Lorenzo's win for ESC 2014] Yes, ladies and gentlemen, 
Francesco had read all our tweets,  he even liked more than just one 
and he has sent me a shout-out. Yup, it happened. A freakin' shout-out. He has sent me 
a freakin' shout-out. Yes, ladies and gentlemen, here you 
have it - a shout-out, to me! To me - say what? "@ItsMalbert", it says here.
This here is gold. ['Me he enamorado' - Camela]
*I fell in love with her* Yeah, I had it framed, okay? I'll put it right over there, so that I can
 look at it every morning and be motivated. You know, it's like when you guys 
graduate and get your diploma. Well then, this is my graduation 
diploma ‚Äì Francesco's greetings. And this isn't just any greeting.
No, no. "Ciao" - hi! Is that a simple "hello" 
or more like "Hi, my dear"...  ... you can take it however you want. "@ItsMalbert" - I mean, he tagged ME. He knows who I am, 
he searched for me. He didn't miss a single letter, 
there's my full name. "Ciao @ItsMalbert", 
then "! ! ! !" One, two, three, 
four exclamation marks. Do you know what that means in Italian? "Ciao @ItsMalbert!!!!"
It's like... You guys can think whatever you want, 
but this is like: "Hi, darling, I am here!" "Grazie." - he's thanking me. Francesco's thanking me, 
his new best friend. "Grazie del sostegno." 
- thank you for your support. Oh my, I'm having a hot flush 
just thinking about it. And two emoticons! Two!
Like this... Like, "Thank you so much, 
my dear. Thank you." As in, "I'll drop by your place soon."  ... it's like a code between 
me and him, you know. And most importantly, 
at the end of the tweet: "Un abbraccio." I'm not sure if I pronounced it correctly 
but, hey, I couldn't care less! I'm getting off the train of life! 'Cause, man, after all the promotion
I did for Italy in this year's ESC,  at the very least they should 
name a street after me in Rome.  At the entrance of the city. 
Right there, there should be a Malbert Street. Or better yet: 
'Malbert & Francesco Street'.  Right there, on a street sign. I can see it. I can. Oh well, but we'll keep you posted 
on how things go in our relationship. Hello?
Oh, hi Frances! It's Francesco. We [his buddies] 
call him Frances, you know. Tell me, Frances. No, nothing. Just here, 
recording a video for YouTube. All right, I'll tell them. 
He's saying Hi to all of you. Oh, he's such a cool guy. Tell me. OK, no problem. I'm buying the bread tonight, 
don't worry. OK then, see you tonight.
Bye. He's been a bit busy lately with all 
the promotion, the new single and all, and he feels like eating bread for dinner, 
so I have to go buy some bread. Just saying, guys...
I have a feeling that Malbbani is real. And you must be asking: so what do you 
take away from all of this, Malbert? Well, firstly, Francesco's shout out - 
that's more than obvious, of course. But behind all of this, 
there's YOU, guys. And that's what I take from this 
and what really matters to me.  Your views on my channel, the subscribers, 
all the messages you send me,  all the pictures you draw of me, 
all your photo editing - THANK YOU. And the most mind-blowing part 
of it all is that you're writing me from Portugal, Chile, Mexico, 
Malta, Italy, France,  and I just wonder...what-why?  I only have words of gratitude 
for you, really. THANK YOU. So that's all for today's video, guys. I just knew you might be needing 
this video - heck, and so was I! I just HAD to do this video, 
no matter what. I hope you enjoyed it, and if so,
don't forget to put a LIKE on it. And if you didn't, well,
I tell you and your bad taste to... You're free to go. And once again, THANK YOU! I'll leave you here a nice button 
if you want to subscribe,  and over here my latest videos. You have all my social networks 
down here on the details. And see you on my next video!

transcript:
Hi there, I'm Malbert! And here we are, it's another day...
and that's reason enough to celebrate! ['Cuando zarpa el amor' - Camela]
*when love sails away* Indeed it is, my fellas! My lovely, pretty fellas - you're the best! And I mean it. 
I couldn‚Äôt freakin' love you more, guys. To all those who watch my live streams 
on Instagram, you're awesome, really! I couldn't have had more fun!  And I almost pee my pants when you 
send me all the screenshots you capture. And man, do I have quite a mug 
on those screenshots...you bastards! You know I love you, 
but man, you are such bastards. And if you're still a knucklehead 
and aren't already following me on Instagram and don't want to miss my live-streaming videos, 
just do me a favor and follow me. If not...buzz off! Ouch, I hurt myself. I have a major announcement to tell you all! It turned out that during my last week's 
live stream, my correspondent in Italy - Ludovica, a really nice girl to whom 
I'd like to say a big Thank You - ...started the hashtag #FrancescoMalberEsiste.
[Francesco, Malbert exists] OK, and that means what exactly? It‚Äôs "esiste", with an 'S'. Seriously, I pee my pants with you, guys. 'cause I realized you were literally 
harassing Francesco Gabbani by sending him screenshots of my videos 
and telling him to please give me a shout-out  on a video, or in any way. So, this girl started this 
hashtag for you to tweet, so that Gabbani would say Hi to me 
and to all of you following along  or to whomever - to at least let him know I exist. Therefore, I invite you all to tweet 
#FrancescoMalbertEsiste as of today, starting at 9 p.m. You can send him pictures, screenshots 
of my videos, your own edits, memes, anything you want, but above all 
you have to tweet a lot! Can you imagine if we get
to be a trending topic? I'll pass out! I will! Oh well, but I'd already take comfort 
in knowing he's aware of my existence and in him greeting us all.  But I'll be damned if I don't get a 
shout-out from Francesco Gabbani! That said, 
let's move on to today's country. And it's a country that super raises my spirits. And I mean super, like, SUPER! "Hey, Malbert, do you know any other words?" - "Yeah."
- "Ok then, prove it." "Well...Super! 
SUPER SUPER!" And with good reason - it has become 
one of the favorites to win,  competing with none other than Italy. With Italy? 
SAY WHAT? Competing with Francesco? 
SAY WHAT? Who's better than 
Francesco Gabbani? WHO? WHO?  No one. So, today I'm talking about 
none other thaN...Belgium! ['What's the pressure?' - Laura Tesoro (ESC 2016)] Yes! 
God, I love this song! Oh yeah, I believe Belgium is one of 
the countries that have really been  impressing us lately with its musical tastes. And thank goodness - these past few years 
Belgium has been gaining momentum. Year after year, 
they show up at ESC pretty much saying:  "Sweden... Russia... I'm here!" "And I came here to stay!" And no wonder - by the looks of it we could 
pretty much call Belgium the 'new Sweden'. And they've had some underrated entries, 
like that great one by Kate Ryan. [ 'Je t'adore' ‚Äì Kate Ryan (ESC 2006) ] Or the one I consider to be the best, 
the freakin' best Belgian act... Juan, drumroll please...thank you. The best Belgian act has been 
and will always be...  Lo√Øc Nottet. ['Rhythm Inside' - Lo√Øc Nottet (ESC 2015)] OMG OMG OMG, I loved that song! Well, and still love, 
'cause it's quite an awesome song. Really, I'm telling you, 
I lived that song -and I lived it to its fullest. Oops. Ouch...I almost kill myself. Damn, I nearly dismantled my neck. So, this year...
Oh my! This year... Tremendous surprise! Super super tremendous surprise!
This year they bring us a smash hit. This year Belgium will be 
represented by Blanche. I think I said it right this time. It's spelled 'Blanche' ‚Äì I'll just read it 
the good old traditional way. And she brings a song called 'City Lights'. This is massive! Absolute smash hit!
I couldn't be more of a fan. It's quite an original song, so different,
that stands out among all those ballads. Her voice might sound a bit flat,
but then with that whole musical production‚Ä¶ ... it just is AMAZING. It leads to 
flat-out addiction. Like Norway's. Really, this song has the ability 
to beam you up to somewhere else,  it just makes you dive into it. Shit, Christmas light bulbs burn!   I'm pretty confident that 
this song is going to stand out.  We should bear in mind that there are 
some very good songs, and then... Well, and then there's Italy.  Then on the other side, we have some bad songs
and some REALLY bad songs, and then... Then we have San Marino. And Malta. Therefore, that's why I believe 
Belgium will stand out. And although I really like 
this year's Belgian entry, I... Sorry. I thought I had a booger. Although I really like this year's Belgian entry, 
I'm sorry but I don‚Äôt feel like it's going to win. I do believe it will make it -and merits- at least to 
Top 10, but I feel like it won't even get to Top 5.  And some people find this song boring. 
Boring? Say what? Huh? SAY WHAT? With all those lights turning on and off the 
whole time, there's no way you could feel bored. You'd sooner go blind 
than get bored, that's what. We've got Valentina Monetta's career 
for that - now that‚Äôs boring as it is. So that's one of the great advantages for Belgium, 
they can play with the whole 'lights theme' thing  and their staging can benefit greatly from that, 
with all the lights, LEDs and all that. I don‚Äôt know what the hell
they will do for the performance,  but I hope they do something really cool 
'cause they have everything going for them. OK, so we all agree that her face is less expressive 
than Iniesta's [Barcelona football player] but I dig this inexpressiveness thing, 
I think it kind of gives her character, like... "Look how happy I am. I just stuffed myself with 
two hot dogs and right now I'm shitting myself." "I'd like to go to the toilet to unload this all
but I'll just keep on stuffing myself..." "... with all the hot dogs I can. 
I'm super happy." I just hope she's conscious that when someone 
is so inexpressive, they have to fill that visual gap  by using a light show and a good staging, 
apart from the music. So I hope she won't disappoint us in that area. However, her live performance 
at the London Pre-Party... Can you explain me where did her voice go? Where? 
'Cause I can't find it. So can you freakin' explain me 
that freakin' disappointment we all freakin' got? "Freakin-freakin-freakin"
- will you stop already? No, seriously, it was quite a 
disappointment for all the Eurofans,  because at the beginning of 
the performance we were all like... And then we ended like...Huh? Girl, why are you doing this? Girl, with that awesome tune you have! Why? 
Why you‚Äôre doing that? ['Me has hecho mucho da√±o' - Camela]
*you've hurt me so much* It was just like when we heard that Mirela was 
going to 'Objectivo Eurovisi√≥n', we were all like... "Whoa!!! Mirela for Eurovision!" "Mirela for Eurovision!" And then she brings us...
'Contigo' ['With you']. With you WHAT? I don't like it, period. I'm sorry to say, but I didn't like 
Blanche's live performance at all. And, just like France has improved their live 
performance, I hope that Belgium does it, too. So that's all for today's video, guys.
I hope you enjoyed it, and if so... ... don't forget to put a LIKE on it. And if you didn't, well,
I tell you and your bad taste to... You're free to go. You have all my social networks on the details. Please don't forget you can keep tweeting 
#FrancescoMalbertEsiste. And you can also keep sending me questions 
by using #MalbertAlAparato. I'll leave you here a nice button if you want 
to subscribe and not miss a single video. And over here, my latest videos.
See you on my next video! You can bugger off.

transcript:
Hi there! I'm Malbert and today I'd like 
to tell you about something that finally, FINALLY... - and let's all sing 'Aleluia' - Finally an amazing song! Finally a great song in ESC 2017! And this deserves a big round of applause. Enough. So I'm here to tell you about 
a country that rarely lets me down, since its songs have always been 
in my Top 3 for the last years. I'm talking about none other than the great, the distinctive, the amazing... ... Italy! Artists such as Marco Mengoni, Il Volo, Francesca, "La mia citt√†" - I just loved all their songs! And if you are true Eurofans, 
you may remember Marco Mengoni...whoa! [Camela - 'Me he enamorado']
*I feel in love with her and I can't hide it* *I love her and yet I can't kiss her* My goodness, that Marco Mengoni!
That was one hell of a song, back in 2013! [Marco Mengoni - L'Essenziale]
*while the world breaks into pieces* *I create new places and desires* All those amazing songs and artists 
just show the immense talent in Italy and the great song contest that is Sanremo Festival. Now that's a song contest, 
and not what we have here in Spain. RTVE [Spanish public broadcaster], you hear me? 
Take note. [watch and learn] I mean, even the festivities here in my neighborhood 
have a better festival than 'Objetivo Eurovisi√≥n'... ... and they're like a cheap version of 'Tu S√≠ Que Vales' [TV talent show], only with four balloons and three streamers . To√±i Prieto and Fede [the heads of RTVE's selection for Eurovision], 
when are you finally resigning? Just when, I wonder? Anyway, enough with the comparisons 
and let's just get to business. Let's get to the matter in hand. Francesco Gabbani has emerged victorious in Sanremo Festival, therefore earning a one-way ticket straight to ESC 2017. This year's Italian representative is bringing 
the song 'Occidentali's Karma'. Point number 1: can somebody please explain me 
why all Italians are drop dead gorgeous? Why do they have all that attractive power and magnetism? They have such an incredible attractive power! What do they put in their pasta? Tell me!
What do you Italians put in your pizza? 'Cause I want it. The thing is, this song rocks, 
I totally love it! And it's definitely one of my Top... ...well, actually, my Top 1. 
'Cause there are no others for me. For me, at this point, he's the winner. But, of course, we only know 11 or 12 songs by now... ... so my opinion is not so objective. So, finally someone brings 
a song with such a good vibe. I mean, the very first moment I listened to it
I immediately felt like dancing! Like it charges your batteries. It puts a smile on you and you feel like dancing, 
'cause this guy is so cool it just puts you in a good mood! And I'm not even talking about the lyrics or the rhythm, ... but it's the way he is on stage, his charisma. 
It's amazing how he lights up that stage by himself, ... with his good vibe, 
he  just oozes positive energy! Oh, and what about this plant I bought myself? Watch out, Roc√≠o was about to kill herself! Look at the little plant I bought for myself. For 3 Euros, in Aldi.
[discount grocery store] Fancy!
I'm so proud of my plant. Boy, tell me about it! When I watched 
his performance on the Sanremo finals... ...it just scared the shit out of me! I mean, I was like watching that handsome guy, 
doing his thing, so cool and amusing... ... when suddenly I see a gorilla dancing right next to him. Well, at first I thought: "Jimmy Jump has dressed up as gorilla and invaded the stage again!"
[a Spanish streaker known for invading ESC and other major events] But no - right there, in the middle of a performance 
during Sanremo finals, they've put nothing less than... You tell me. Some backing singers? Some dancers? A gorilla! A gorilla. So, because the song has some subtle references to 
Darwin's Theory of Evolution, among others... ... this guy had the brilliant idea 
to put a gorilla on stage. Hey, no objection - it's not like it's a bad idea.
On the contrary, I think it's actually funny... ... and it's visually fun to see the contrast between 
the guy, all dressed-up, and then a gorilla right beside him. But let me tell you something,
it's not all nice reviews here, ok? I may find it awesome, amazing and quite 
remarkable, the idea of putting a gorilla on stage. But tell me...wasn't there 
a gorilla suit a bit more... - and I think I'm not asking too much -
But, I mean, a gorilla suit a bit more realistic? I mean, even I could make a 
better gorilla suit from garbage bags. And on top of it, they've put him a bow tie. What for? It's like, 
"Hey, I'm a gorilla, but I'm all dressed up." I mean, no. I hope at least for ESC they'll present 
a proper gorilla suit, a bit more realistic. Anyway, one other thing I really enjoyed was 
seeing that well-dressed guy doing those moves. But let me tell you something, Francesco Gabbani: Your song is awesome, 
you have an incredibly good vibe, you sing pretty well and 
you're drop dead gorgeous. But as far as having an innovative choreography goes, I'm telling you, you're not.
And I'll just tell you why. Because that choreography is a Melody heritage.
[Spanish singer] And nobody messes with my Melody! And don't tell me that 
Francesco Gabbani isn't a fan of Melody! Let's see, he puts a gorilla on stage 
AND he does the gorilla dance. He might as well just say "Soy una rumbera!"
[I'm a rumba dancer] Can you imagine that?
Oh, I'd so love it! *I'm a rumba dancer* *hands up* *hands down* *do it like the gorillas* All joking aside, this is the entry 
that wins me over the most. He just lights up the stage 
with this awesome vibe and positive energy. You don't even need to understand the whole lyrics 
to get the essence of its message. And that's what we ask of an ESC song,
to deliver a message, a presence that fills up the stage, 
a well-produced tune, .... that tells you a message and 
gets you hooked from the very first listen. And that's what happened to me with this song. Although I know it's way too soon to say it,
 for now I'm going with Italy. And I wish you, Francesco Gabbani... - like he's actually going to meet me - I wish you all the best and, if you ever come to Spain to 
promote or something, perhaps you could drop by my place. But now I'm thinking... He's Italian, 
so he won't understand what I'm saying. Hey, but I know a bit of Italian. "The lady eats an apple". "The man reads the newspaper". And that's it, the only two sentences I've learned 
after two weeks on Duolingo. But since we're at it anyway, 
let's try and send Francesco a message in Italian. Francesco... "Francesco, your song is my favourite entry in ESC". No, 'in' is English.
Let's start again. "Francesco, your song is my favourite ESC entry". "I wish you all the best and 
when you come to Spain, come visit me". Well, to sum up, his song is my favourite and if he ever 
comes to Spain maybe he could drop by my place. I don't know, I'd throw a party 
and make some paella. So that's all for today's video, guys.
I hope you enjoyed it, and if so... ... don't forget to put a LIKE on it. And if you didn't, well,
I tell you and your bad taste to... You're free to go. And if you'd like me to do a review on any other 
ESC 2017 entry, just leave a comment here. You have all my social networks on the details.
See you on my next video! Someday I will end up dismantling my neck.
